DOC.HEAD: Guerrillas Announce Cease-fire for Holidays
DOC.TEXT: Leftist rebels said Friday they would observe a cease-fire for the Christmas holidays, and the government promised to lift a curfew imposed because of the latest guerrilla offensive. A statement from the rebel Farabundo Marti National Liberation Front said it would stop fighting from Saturday, Dec. 23, through Jan. 2 so Salvadorans could enjoy the holidays in peace. It also said, without elaboration, that the guerrillas had asked U.N. Secretary-General Javier Perez de Cuellar ``to reopen a process of real negotiations to end the war.'' President Alfredo Cristiani's government said the 11 p.m.-5 a.m. curfew would end on Christmas Eve. The curfew was imposed in November after the rebels began their most intense and prolonged attack of the 10-year-old war, bringing the battle to San Salvador for most of the month.
